title: Reflective Teaching Method Design for Inclusive Higher Education of Students with Disabilities: Strengthening Social Relationships and Institutional Support

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge of socio-historical contexts, institutional support systems, practical experience, and awareness of educational rights for students with disabilities
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-based learning environments, targeting professionals with practical experience to strengthen social inclusion and improve educational systems, with emphasis on citizen rights assurance and inter-institutional collaboration frameworks

learning_goals: Design three or more personalized learning strategies that support the formation of social relationships and strengthen civic rights for students with disabilities using reflective teaching methods
Propose institutional accessibility measures for curricula and strategies to ensure the rights of students with disabilities through the application of flexible teaching methodologies

By the end of the 6-month course, learners will create one project plan for implementing an inclusive educational environment within vocational training institutions, propose three cultural/institutional improvement directions, and submit a revised version incorporating feedback from institutional officers

resources: Case Study Materials for Students with Disabilities
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
